result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Comply with Deferred Prosecution Agreement
*Provide monthly reporting, first day of each month, file a report.
*Sign releases to make sure Defendant is complying with what the agreement is calling for.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed with Prejudice
*Reason:  Defendant has complied with all requirements of the DPA

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel M. Miller Jr.

defendant.name: Miller, Joel M., Jr.
defendant.address: 4501 Pine Ridge Drive, Apt. #5, Stevens Point, WI 54481

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel M. Miller in court with attorney Brian T. Kane. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:35 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

This is set for a plea today.

There is an agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in.

Atty Kane concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kane for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD ENTRY of Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Victim is not present but did provide a brief statement which Atty Knaapen reads.
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, there has not been a request for restitution. 
Atty Kane makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Court approves and signs the Deferred Prosecution Agreement 
Comply with this for 12 Months
Provide monthly reporting, first day of each month, file a report
Sign releases to make sure Defendant is complying with what the agreement is calling for
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel M. Miller in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Court informs about public defender attorney and court appointed attorney.
P/NG entered.
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joel M. Miller Jr.
Current: 4501 Pine Ridge Drive, Apt. #5, Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 01-25-2016)
Prior: 4501 Pine Ridge Drive, Apt. #8, Stevens Point, WI 54481
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  NO violent or abusive contact with Marion Frey.

1:19 p.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA  states facts for anticipated charges of disorderly conduct and damage to property
Court questions Defendant. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a sig bond $2000  with conditions as stated.  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  NO violent or abusive contact with Marion Frey.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  1-25-16  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
